intro: Dracontocephalum laciniatum, commonly known as the shredded head plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that are deeply lobed and often appear shredded. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its unique foliage, it is occasionally cultivated as an ornamental plant in tropical gardens.
